summary: This bill, the Protecting Communities from Helicopter Noise Act, directs the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) to study helicopter operations within a 20-mile radius of the Statue of Liberty National Monument. The study will analyze the impact of helicopter noise on residential and recreational areas, including traffic volume, noise levels, and safety concerns. It will also explore solutions to mitigate noise pollution, such as diverting helicopter routes and establishing altitude limits. The FAA is required to submit a report to Congress detailing the study's findings.
